title: List of National University of Kyiv-Mohyla Academy people
data: Minister of justice of Russia in 1814
Founder of the Black Sea Cossack Host
Minister of Education and Science of Ukraine
Secretary of International Affairs for Ukraine
Deputy of the Verkhovna Rada ; Deputy Prime Minister of Ukraine in the first cabinet of Yulia Tymoshenko
Member of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine of 6th convocation ; Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine
Deputy of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine
Minister of Economical Development and Trade of Ukraine
Press secretary of the President of Ukraine Viktor Yuschenko
Minister of Education in Russia in 1802
section_text: Alexander Bezborodko , Grand Chancellor of Russia
intro: This is a list of notable people associated with the National University of Kyiv-Mohyla Academy (NaUKMA), a public research university located in Kyiv, Ukraine. Students, alumni and faculty members of the university and all its predecessor institutions including Kyiv Brotherhood School (KBS), Kyiv-Mohyla Collegium (KMC), Kyiv-Mohyla Academy (KMA) and Kyiv Theological Academy (KTA) are included in this list. Many students and professors of Kyiv-Mohyla Academy in the 17th and 18th centuries pursued many activities except church career. They were often also writers, philosophers, theologicians and educators in a broad sense. This is indicated in the list where appropriate.
